result.execSummary:
The defendant Ty T Stafford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Defendant is to receive sentence credit of 1 day.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ty T Stafford

defendant.name: Stafford, Ty T
defendant.address: N0733 N East St, Dalton, WI 53926

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:23 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - met with the DA and reached an agreement.  DA recites agreement - will recommend jail and court costs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-10 days county jail with huber.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

1 day of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 9:30 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Ty T Stafford
Current: N0733 N East St, Dalton, WI 53926 United States  (Effective: 05-31-2016)
Prior: N0733 N East St PO Box 12, Dalton, WI 53926

Defendant is to have No Contact with Theresa B.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on June 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.

8:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Defendant requests to talk with the DA.  Court determines the defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 14, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:46 a.m.

Defendant is to have No Contact with Theresa B.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.

1:46 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the court - finds probable cause for the charge.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to have No Contact with Theresa B.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant to return to court on May 31, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:49 p.m.
